column4: how come when i 'sudo apt-get install xine' it says no package dont u think xine has apackage
ok pestilence thanks
blissex how do i configure my x
anyone know how i can configure my X so that my gdm boots up
grrr...someone please help me configure my x so that my gdm boots up..i get this ridculous looking login screen when i boot my comp
how do i configure my x so that my gdm loads PLEASE HELP!
what exactly happens?
does X start? If it starts, how?
when you turn on your PC, what do you see on the screen at the end of boot?
but what is on the screen?
so it is not a console login, it is graphical. Is it? Nice windows and the logo?
OK, then what you need to do is to tell the system to start GDM instead of that.
/etc/X11/default-display-manager
login, edit that. probalby it now says 'xdm', put 'gdm' instead.
im really hardcore newb...what do i do with that string type it in terM?
log in, then _edit_ that file.
you now, it is a text file, and you can use something like 'gedit' to cjhange it.
change the 'xdm' to gdm'... But wait a sec.
open a console window, and type 'which gdm'
exactly!
OK...
